```{r} #| label: setup #| include: false library(dplyr) library(glue) library(knitr) df <- read.csv("../data.csv", stringsAsFactors = FALSE) ``` # CRGE Historical Database Welcome to the English version of the **CRGE Historical Database**, a comprehensive resource documenting Christian missionary history and religious agency in East Asia.

## About This Database This digital archive contains extensive documentation of Christian missionary activities, religious movements, and cultural interactions across East Asian regions including China, Korea, Japan, Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Manchuria. The content spans from the late 19th century through the modern era, offering insights into the complex relationships between Christianity and local societies. ## Database Overview ```{r} #| label: database_stats #| results: asis #| echo: false # Calculate basic statistics total_entries <- nrow(df) total_areas <- length(unique(df$area[!is.na(df$area) & df$area != ""])) total_periods <- length(unique(df$period[!is.na(df$period) & df$period != ""])) total_topics <- length(unique(df$topic[!is.na(df$topic) & df$topic != ""])) # Count entries with English content entries_with_content <- df %>% filter(!is.na(text_en), nzchar(text_en)) %>% nrow() cat(glue("- **Total Database Entries:** {format(total_entries, big.mark = ',')}\n")) cat(glue("- **Geographic Areas:** {total_areas}\n")) cat(glue("- **Time Periods:** {total_periods}\n")) cat(glue("- **Topics Covered:** {total_topics}\n")) cat(glue("- **Entries with English Content:** {format(entries_with_content, big.mark = ',')}\n\n")) ``` ## Geographic Coverage ```{r} #| label: geographic_breakdown #| results: asis #| echo: false # Get breakdown by area area_stats <- df %>% filter(!is.na(area), area != "") %>% group_by(area) %>% summarise( total_entries = n(), periods = n_distinct(period[!is.na(period) & period != ""]), with_english = sum(!is.na(text_en) & nzchar(text_en)), .groups = 'drop' ) %>% arrange(desc(total_entries)) for (i in 1:nrow(area_stats)) { area <- area_stats$area[i] total <- area_stats$total_entries[i] periods <- area_stats$periods[i] english <- area_stats$with_english[i] cat(glue("**{area}:** {format(total, big.mark = ',')} entries across {periods} time periods ({format(english, big.mark = ',')} with English content)\n\n")) } ``` ## Browse by Region ### üá®üá≥ China - [Pre-1900](China/Pre1900.html) - [1900-1910](China/1900-1910.html) - *More periods coming soon* ### üá∞üá∑ Korea - [Pre-1900](Korea/Pre-1900/Agency/Christian-Leaders.html) - [1900-1910](Korea/1900-1910/Agency/Christian-Leaders.html) - [1910-1920](Korea/1910-1920/Agency/Christian-Leaders.html) - [1920-1930](Korea/1920-1930/Agency/Christian-Leaders.html) - [1930-1940](Korea/1930-1940/Agency/Christian-Leaders.html) - [1940-1950](Korea/1940-1950/Agency/Christian-Leaders.html) - [1950-1960](Korea/1950-1960/Agency/Christian-Leaders.html) - [1960-1970](Korea/1960-1970/Agency/Christian-Leaders.html) - [1970-1980](Korea/1970-1980/Agency/Christian-Leaders.html) - [1980-1990](Korea/1980-1990/Agency/Christian-Leaders.html) - [1990-2000](Korea/1990-2000/Agency/Christian-Leaders.html) ### üáØüáµ Japan *Coming soon* ### üáπüáº Taiwan *Coming soon* ### üá≠üá∞ Hong Kong *Coming soon* ### Manchuria *Coming soon* ## Content Organization Each regional section is organized by: - **Agency** (Religious actors and movements) - Christian or Pro-Christian Leaders - Christian or Pro-Christian Organizations - Christian or Pro-Christian Events/Movements - Key Theological Issues - Anti-Christian Leaders - Anti-Christian Organizations - Anti-Christian Events/Movements - Bibliography - **Context** (Historical background) - Governmental Regulations on Religion - Social Hostility toward Christianity - Geopolitical Dynamics - Bibliography ## Sample Content ```{r} #| label: sample_content #| results: asis #| echo: false # Show a sample entry sample_entry <- df %>% filter(!is.na(text_en), nzchar(text_en), !is.na(area), !is.na(period), !is.na(topic), !is.na(section)) %>% slice(1) if (nrow(sample_entry) > 0) { area <- sample_entry$area[1] period <- sample_entry$period[1] topic <- sample_entry$topic[1] section <- sample_entry$section[1] text <- sample_entry$text_en[1] # Truncate text if too long if (nchar(text) > 300) { text <- paste0(substr(text, 1, 300), "...") } cat(glue("Here's an example entry from **{area} ({period})** under the topic **{topic}**, section **{section}**:\n\n")) cat(glue("> {text}\n\n")) } ``` --- *Center on Religion and the Global East*
